review_title: Community Outreach Specialist- St. Johns Episcopal
job_title: Community OUtreach Specialist in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Flexible schedule since most of our title was field work & community event. Great Pay Excellent 1199 Benefits
cons: Unstable as this position was grant funded.

job_title: Manager in Queens, NY
pros: Great benefits. Great place to learn; opportunity for growth.
cons: There need to be culture shift from the top down. Managment can't manage if leadership is not willing to support change.

job_title: Data Scientist in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Pay more considering no one wants to work there
cons: location is undesirable along with the work culture

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Generalist 2 in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Great Place to work. Co-workers are friendly.
cons: Management needs to learn how to manage people.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Benefits and never bring work home
cons: No room for growth, management doesn’t work with staff, harder workers do all the work, management scared of union and seniority, does not like continuing education unless you can cover your shifts and others.

job_title: Certified Medical Office Assistant in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Pays more than the average CMA rate
cons: Commute is always heavy traffic if you don’t live nearby

pros: It’s a great environment and friendly.

review_title: Sometimes you are the pigeon and sometimes you are the statue.
job_title: Executive Assistant in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Providing healthcare to a community in need.
cons: Many colleague's inability and willingness to effectively and efficiently communicate --intent vs impact! The administration's elevating/promoting from within approach and not investing in recruitment firms for all C-level positions across the board.

job_title: Director of Physician Practice Management in New York, NY
pros: Care for the employees, lots of training
cons: safety net hospital, short staffed at times

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in New York, NY
pros: Good work place, small, nice people
cons: I don't have bad experience yet

job_title: Maintenance Technician in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Some really good people work there that are willingly to work hard and make it better work experience.
cons: Poor communication and lack of support from higher ups

job_title: Internal Medicine Resident in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Complex medical cases provide significant clinical experience
cons: Ancillary care is a large part of job

job_title: RN-Pulmonary Med-surg Unit/Charge Nurse and Preceptor in Springfield Gardens, NY
pros: Friendly co workers and team work was great. Did not have any problems getting time off. I loved working 12 hour shifts.
cons: The community is horrible. Very low class people and many NH in the area. A lot of bedsores and total care

job_title: Executive Chef/Assistant Director of Food and Nutrition in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Friendly co-workers, most employees have good qualifications and understand what to do
cons: long commute, upper management out of touch with most of the front line employees

job_title: Clinical Barbaric Coordinator in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: opportunity to provide service to population that  needs  a lot of  medical and  preventive care and education
cons: poor management, no  consequence   for job done poorly. poor management  in financial department for billing of services

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Far Rockaway, NY

cons: Nasty, irresponsible, ignorant, lazy and very disrespectful co-workers. Management had a very weak control over employees who were incredibly disrespectful towards managers too.
